metadata.title: CVE-2021-47115 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nfc: fix NULL ptr dereference in llcp_sock_getname() after failed connectIt's possible to trigger NULL pointer dereference by local unprivilegeduser, when calling getsockname() after failed bind() (e.g. the bindfails because LLCP_SAP_MAX used as SAP):  BUG: kernel NULL pointer dereference, address: 0000000000000000  CPU: 1 PID: 426 Comm: llcp_sock_getna Not tainted5.13.0-rc2-next-20210521+ #9  Hardware name: QEMU Standard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOS 1.14.0-104/01/2014  Call Trace:   llcp_sock_getname+0xb1/0xe0   __sys_getpeername+0x95/0xc0   ? lockdep_hardirqs_on_prepare+0xd5/0x180   ? syscall_enter_from_user_mode+0x1c/0x40   __x64_sys_getpeername+0x11/0x20   do_syscall_64+0x36/0x70   entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x44/0xaeThis can be reproduced with Syzkaller C repro (bind followed bygetpeername):https://syzkaller.appspot.com/x/repro.c?x=14def446e00000
